ygData.subject: Re: jewelry/tailor knowledge needed!
ygData.msgSnippet: Actually, don t bother enchanting. Enchanted jewelry only sells better. I ve never heard of it making any difference to leveling up Jewelry skills. Only thing
ygData.messageBody:
Actually, don't bother enchanting. Enchanted
jewelry only sells better. I've never heard of it making
any difference to leveling up Jewelry skills. Only
thing that does is a high Int... and some say a high
Wis. Some say either high int or high wis. Others say
one or the other with a benefit with a high secondary
stat. Etc. <br><br>Now if you're enchanting it to make
it sell better to players. Yes, do that. That's the
way to make money off the tradeskill.<br><br>The BEST
site for trade skills is www.eqtraders.com. The most
comprehensive trade skill site there is out
there.<br><br>Fatedhue Prismatic<br>Master Baker, Beggar, Brewer,
Forager.<br>Excellent Fletcher (need 3 more points to master).<br>Good
Smith. Master of all skills that can be mastered by
Druid except for Hand to Hand, Smithing, Jewelry,
Fletching, Pottery, and most languages (have however,
mastered Barbarian, and Dwarf... and gotten Elder Dragon
to Above Average).<br><br>PS... sorry. I'm sorta
proud (probably excessively so) that I've mastered so
many skills,and have so many languages. And only died
27 times at level 38. Course that doesn't mean I
know the game all that well. Just lucky.
=)<br><br><br>PPS... if anyone in Drinal has any odd languages
mastered, I would LOVE to learn them. Don't know how much
ya'll would charge me though. I'm about to have to
purchase 39 spells. Be a bit short on plat. I've only got
250 in the bank and that means after spells, I'll
have 40 plat (if lucky).<br><br>shooman out
